questions.question_text:
A developer wants to invoke an outbound message when a record meets a specific criteria.
Which three features satisfy this use case? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Process builder can be used to check the record criteria and send an outbound message without Apex Code.
choices.C: Approval Process has the capability to check the record criteria and send an outbound message without Apex Code.
choices.D: Workflows can be used to check the record criteria and send an outbound message.
choices.E: Visual Workflow can be used to check the record criteria and send an outbound message without Apex Code.
choices.A: Process builder can be used to check the record criteria and send an outbound message with Apex Code.

discussion.content: ACD is correct answer.
C and D only. Outbound message can only be invoced via Workflow rules, Approval process or Record-trigerred flow. You can`t invoke Outbound message using Apex, or it will be called Apex callout.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants Opportunities to be locked from editing when reaching the Closed/Won stage.
Which two strategies should a developer use to accomplish this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Lock Record is a Flow Builder feature, so AB https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=platform.flow_ref_elements_actions_lockrecord.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: AB
A. Use Flow Builder
You can create an automated process using Flow Builder that locks the record from being edited when the Opportunity reaches the "Closed/Won" stage.

B. Use a Validation Rule
A validation rule can be set up to check if the Opportunity is in the "Closed/Won" stage and prevent any further changes by blocking edits.

Selected Answer: BC
Validation rule and Approval process as Process Automation tool (if they don't mean that 'Process Automation Settings' it's a page in Setup UI)

While Option B (using a validation rule) is a valid solution, Option D (marking fields as read-only on the page layout) is not sufficient to prevent the record from being edited after reaching the Closed/Won stage.

The reason for this is that read-only fields on a page layout can still be edited using other methods, such as data loader or API calls. Therefore, it is recommended to use the Process Automation settings to lock the record when it reaches a specific stage.

So, the correct options would be B and C, not B and D.

A team of many developers work in their own individual orgs that have the same configuration as the production org.

Which type of org is best suited for this scenario?

choices.C: The Apex transaction fails with the following message: SObject row was retrieved via SOQL without querying the requested field: Account.Is_Tech__c.
